H0.text: Bigger branches are the most advantageous plant variation for the survival of the species if the climate in an area becomes much drier.

H1.text: Larger flowers would be the most advantageous plant variation for the survival of the species if the climate in an area were to become much drier.

H2.text: Thicker leaves are the plant variation that would be most advantageous to the survival of the species if the climate in an area were to become much drier.

H3.text: Longer stems would be the most advantageous plant variation for the survival of the species if the climate in an area were to become much drier.

A4.text: Xerophytic plants typically have less surface to volume ratio than other plants, so as to minimize water loss by transpiration and evaporation. They can may have fewer and smaller leaves or fewer branches than other plants.
